--- title: `loss_functions` keywords: fastai sidebar: home_sidebar summary: "This module contains implementations of the loss functions associated with uncensored data, as defined in the original DRSA paper." description: "This module contains implementations of the loss functions associated with uncensored data, as defined in the original DRSA paper." ---
{% raw %}
{% endraw %}

As defined in the DRSA paper

  • Discrete event rate (empirical CDF):

{% raw %} $$ W(t_l) = Pr(z \leq t_l) = \sum_{j\leq l}Pr(z\in V_j) $$ {% endraw %}

  • Discrete Survival function:

{% raw %} $$ S(t_l) = Pr(z > t_l) = \sum_{j > l}Pr(z\in V_j) $$ {% endraw %}

  • Discrete event time probability function (empirical PDF):

{% raw %} $$p_l = Pr(z\in V_t) = W(t_l) - W(t_{l-1}) = S(t_{l-1}) - S(t_{l})$$ {% endraw %}

  • Discrete conditional hazard rate:

{% raw %} $$h_l = Pr(z\in V_l | z > t_{l-1}) = \frac{Pr(z\in V_l)}{Pr(z>t_{l-1})} = \frac{p_l}{S(t_{l-1})}$$ {% endraw %}

{% endraw %} {% raw %}

survival_rate(ts)

{% endraw %} {% raw %}

event_rate[source]

event_rate(ts)

event_time[source]

event_time(ts)

{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
ts1 = torch.tensor([[0.001],
                    [0.5],
                    [0.55],
                    [0.15],
                    [0.15],
                    [0.15],
                    [0.15],
                    [0.9]], requires_grad=True)

ts2 = torch.tensor([[0.001],
                    [0.005],
                    [0.1],
                    [0.11],
                    [0.12],
                    [0.15],
                    [0.15],
                    [0.9]], requires_grad=True)

ts = torch.stack([ts1, ts2], dim=0)
print(ts.shape)
print(f"Survival rate:\n {survival_rate(ts)}")
print(f"Event rate:\n {event_rate(ts)}")
print(f"Event time:\n {event_time(ts)}")

torch.Size([2, 8, 1])
Survival rate:
 tensor([[0.0117],
        [0.0506]], grad_fn=<ProdBackward1>)
Event rate:
 tensor([[0.9883],
        [0.9494]], grad_fn=<RsubBackward1>)
Event time:
 tensor([[0.1056],
        [0.4556]], grad_fn=<MulBackward0>)
